roleset.name: separating of a suspension of solid particles (such as red blood cells) in a concentrated solid and a supernatant liquid
roleset.note: SEDIMENTATION-N NOTES: Comparison to verb-separate.01. (from sedimentation.01-n)

example.name: sediment-v
example.text: At the beginning of the Lutetian, transgression (stage 2 of Fig.3), the rivers are changed into estuaries, [glauconitic sand]-1 is sedimented *-1.

example.name: sedimentation-n
example.text: Sedimentation of the channel can also occur, under normal flow conditions, if abnormal amounts of material are being eroded from the banks.
